Title:
A synapmorphic clade in Neoconidiobolus accommodates a new
species and two new combinations
Abstract:
The genus Neoconidiobolus was recently established to
accommodate all members of the Conidiobolus subgenus Conidiobolus. Based
on mitochondrial small subunit (mtSSU), nuclear large subunit (nucLSU)
of rDNA and translation elongation factor 1-alpha (TEF1), this study
further resolved the Neoconidiobolus genus into three clades, with three
new taxa being added. These new taxa formed a monophyletic clade and
share a synapomorph: Their primary conidia are smaller than any species
in the other two clades. They are N. kunyushanensis B. Huang & Y.
Nie, sp. nov. N. lamprauges (Drechsler) B. Huang & Y. Nie, comb.
nov. N. nanodes (Drechsler) B. Huang & Y. Nie, comb. nov.
